description:
'''Rizwan Ahmed''' ({{IPA|ur|ɾɪzˌwɑːn ˈɛɦˌməd̪}}; born {{Birth date|1982|12|1|df=y}}) is a British actor and rapper. He has received [[List of awards and nominations received by Riz Ahmed|several awards]], including an [[Academy Award]] and a [[Primetime Emmy Award]] with nominations for two [[Golden Globe Awards]] and two [[British Academy Film Awards]]. In 2017, he was named by ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' as one of the [[Time 100|most influential people in the world]].

After studying acting at the [[Royal Central School of Speech and Drama]], Ahmed began his acting career with independent films such as ''[[The Road to Guantanamo ]]''(2006), ''[[Shifty (film)|Shifty]]'' (2008), ''[[Four Lions]]'' (2010), ''[[Trishna (2011 film)|Trishna]]'' (2011), and ''[[The Reluctant Fundamentalist (film)|The Reluctant Fundamentalist]]'' (2012). He had his break-out role in ''[[Nightcrawler (film)|Nightcrawler]]'' (2014), which led to roles in the 2016 big-budget films ''[[Jason Bourne (film)|Jason Bourne]]'' and ''[[Rogue One]]''. For starring as a young man accused of murder in the [[HBO]] miniseries ''[[The Night Of]]'' (2016), Ahmed won the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Limited Series or Movie|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Limited Series]]. He received another Emmy nomination in the same year for his guest role in ''[[Girls (TV series)|Girls]]''. He went on to play [[Carlton Drake]] in the superhero film ''[[Venom (2018 film)|Venom]]'' (2018) and a drummer who loses his hearing in the drama film ''[[Sound of Metal]]'' (2019). The latter earned him a nomination for the [[Academy Award for Best Actor]]. He produced, co-wrote, and starred in ''[[Mogul Mowgli]]'' (2020), which earned a nomination for the [[BAFTA Award for Outstanding British Film]].

As a rapper, Ahmed is a member of the [[Swet Shop Boys]], and has earned critical acclaim with the [[Hip hop music|hip hop]] albums ''[[Microscope (album)|Microscope]]'' and ''[[Cashmere (Swet Shop Boys album)|Cashmere]]'', and commercial success featuring in the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart-topping ''[[The Hamilton Mixtape|Hamilton Mixtape]]'', with his song "[[Immigrants (We Get the Job Done)]]" winning an [[MTV Video Music Award]]. His second studio album, ''[[The Long Goodbye (Riz Ahmed album)|The Long Goodbye]],'' was accompanied by a short film of the same name, which won him the [[Academy Award for Best Live Action Short Film]].

As an activist, Ahmed is known for his [[political rap]] music, has been involved in raising awareness and funds for [[Rohingya people|Rohingya]] and [[Refugees of the Syrian Civil War|Syrian refugee]] children, and has advocated ‘BAME’ representation at the [[House of Commons]].
